message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.IT. 

This paper discusses a mechanism for peer-to-peer content distribution, which involves the use of a fountain code at the server to generate new pieces and a prioritization for delivering pieces only to new peers. This mechanism aims to stabilize the system while allowing peers to act greedily. Given the focus on networking and distributed systems, cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also touches on distributed computing (cs.DC), data structures (cs.DS), control systems (cs.SY), and information theory (cs.IT) in its proposed mechanism.
